text: so there's been a lot of debate recently
about whether exercise or nutrition are
more important for losing weight and
it's a fair debate because if you look
at the literature most of it supports
nutrition being the more important part
for losing weight and here's the problem
it depends on how we define losing
weight because exercise is an excellent
way to lose fat and there's a big
difference changes weight fat look if
you want to lose eight pounds lop off an
arm alright it's going to be the fastest
way to do it but if you ultimately want
to lose fat exercise is an important
part of this but realize that unless you
change the dietary intake along with it
most of the research suggests that you
will definitely get healthier with
exercise there's a lot of unique
properties to exercise even without
massive weight loss but realistically if
you're really trying to lose more weight
and more fat modifying both diet and
your exercise patterns are really the
best combination and it's interesting
because most people that say that
they're trying to lose weight don't do
both diet and exercise and it's really
our best combination exercise alone you
won't lose as much weight diet alone you
tend to lose a little bit more muscle
but you'll lose weight put the two
together exercise helps maintain muscle
the nutrition part helps you lose the
body fat along with it there you go
